TopicTitle: Saturn V Parts Pack (v1.1) (NEW: Fixed PNG's)

Articles.Content:
Does anybody have in their squirrelled away resources, a picture of the \'main control room\' at Houston, or something similar? Maybe pictures of the telemetry gear? I have a telemetry system sorted for another monitor (so \'two\' people can play at once, one as the \'crew\', the other as \'Houston\'), but rather than magic some sort of UI out of my arse, it would be nice if it were Houstonish, if you dig?

And before you ask, no, I have not yet set it up to allow remote control (i.e. Houston does the steering etc), although obviously that\'ll be next.
Are you looking for what it\'s like now, or something from e.g. the 60\'s?
The sixties would be great.
I must know what you\'re up to, imdying!
#175 pretty much outlines it. I would like to make it a multiplayer mod, one person as Houston, one as Kerpollo.
Both links are broken!

Both links are broken!

Both links are broken!

Have you tried KSP yard?
Can`t download this file.

Can`t download this file.

...

http://www./?e8x2lzsi9a5kbrp

If anyone is still interested in this, it is very easy to modify the code to enable gimballing engines. Simply go to the part.cfg files, and replace the bit of 'comments' about gimballing (two lines at the bottom with // infront of them) with the line of code in the spoiler. If I get a bit better with maya, I might try to make a full Apollo mission equipped rocket, with Mech Jeb having the ability to launch 2 spacecraft from one rocket, it might not be hard. Or I could be in over my head, would be my first undertaking of that scale either way.

thrustVectoringCapable = True

gimbalRange = 1.0

Just wondering, does this work for demo?

Just wondering, does this work for demo?

This should work fine for the demo. As far as I\'m aware the demo will take mod parts no problem, but it doesn\'t allow for anything requiring a plugin .dll. Most plain parts you find like this should work fine. :thumbup:

(And when you get bored of that, consider buying access to the up-to-date releases. Plugins are aweeeesoooooooooome - never mind all the new gameplay elements that are being added and not included in the demo)

This should work fine for the demo. As far as I\'m aware the demo will take mod parts no problem, but it doesn\'t allow for anything requiring a plugin .dll. Most plain parts you find like this should work fine. :thumbup:

how do i know wheather or not it needs it?

how do i know wheather or not it needs it?

... anything requiring a plugin .dll. ...

If the mod says it requires 0.14 or higher, chances are it\'s because it has a plugin which will not work with the demo.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
